actions.committee: Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition and Forestry
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition and Forestry.

official_title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Adjustment Act to allow the crediting of certain obligations of handlers who engage in the marketing of grapefruit, lemons, or oranges subject to marketing orders if such fruits are grown in the State of Arizona or the State of California.

summary.text: Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to provide for crediting the pro-rata expense obligations of a handler of grapefruit, lemons, and oranges from California and Arizona, pursuant to a marketing order, with all or any portion of such handler's direct expenditures for such marketing promotion.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Adjustment Act to allow the crediting of certain obligations of handlers who engage in the marketing of grapefruit, lemons, or oranges subject to marketing orders if such fruits are grown in the State of Arizona or the State of California.
